content.raw: Take a look at the `~/.gazebo/ogre.log` file, and look for "error" or "exception".
content.html: Take a look at the ~/.gazebo/ogre.log file, and look for "error" or "exception".

content.raw: Is this still a problem? I think you have this working in gazebo4.
content.html: Is this still a problem? I think you have this working in gazebo4.

content.raw:
Hi Steven and Nate

Apologies for the response latency. I recall that I fixed the issue by changing the location of the texture. I previously had put the texture in the model folder, but resolution of the namespace model://... didn't work within <heightmap>. After moving it to the materials/textures path things worked fine. 

Cheers
Andrew
content.html:
Hi Steven and Nate

Apologies for the response latency. I recall that I fixed the issue by changing the location of the texture. I previously had put the texture in the model folder, but resolution of the namespace model://... didn't work within <heightmap>. After moving it to the materials/textures path things worked fine.

Cheers Andrew

content.raw: Fixed by moving textures to the correct path.
content.html: Fixed by moving textures to the correct path.

content.raw:
@asymingt Hi! Could you please describe me your entire valid folder structure, its location on hard drive, URIs in sdf file and maybe the way you run the world?

I have exactly the same problem.

This is my `~/.gazebo` folder, where I run gazebo from.

![Снимок экрана из 2015-07-30 22-35-28-2.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3248819670-Снимок_экрана_из_2015-07-30_22-35-28-2.png)

I run it like

```
gazebo -u --verbose worlds/m.sdf
```

Or even like

```
source /usr/share/gazebo-4.0/setup.sh
export GAZEBO_RESOURCE_PATH=.:$GAZEBO_RESOURCE_PATH
gazebo -u --verbose worlds/m.sdf
```


`ogre.log`:


```
13:25:34: OGRE EXCEPTION(6:FileNotFoundException): Cannot locate resource /home/gosha/.gazebo/media/materials/textures/128.png in resource group General or any other group. in ResourceGroupManager::openResource at /builddir/build/BUILD/ogre-1.9.0/OgreMain/src/OgreResourceGroupManager.cpp (line 756)
13:25:34: Error loading texture /home/gosha/.gazebo/media/materials/textures/128.png. Texture layer will be blank. Loading the texture failed with the following exception: OGRE EXCEPTION(6:FileNotFoundException): Cannot locate resource /home/gosha/.gazebo/media/materials/textures/128.png in resource group General or any other group. in ResourceGroupManager::openResource at /builddir/build/BUILD/ogre-1.9.0/OgreMain/src/OgreResourceGroupManager.cpp (line 756)
13:25:34: OGRE EXCEPTION(6:FileNotFoundException): Cannot locate resource /home/gosha/.gazebo/media/materials/textures/128_normal.png in resource group General or any other group. in ResourceGroupManager::openResource at /builddir/build/BUILD/ogre-1.9.0/OgreMain/src/OgreResourceGroupManager.cpp (line 756)
13:25:34: Error loading texture /home/gosha/.gazebo/media/materials/textures/128_normal.png. Texture layer will be blank. Loading the texture failed with the following exception: OGRE EXCEPTION(6:FileNotFoundException): Cannot locate resource /home/gosha/.gazebo/media/materials/textures/128_normal.png in resource group General or any other group. in ResourceGroupManager::openResource at /builddir/build/BUILD/ogre-1.9.0/OgreMain/src/OgreResourceGroupManager.cpp (line 756)
```

But the paths *are correct*. These files exist.


My world (`m.sdf`):

```
#!xml
<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<sdf version="1.5">
  <world name="default">
    <!-- A global light source -->
    <include>
      <uri>model://sun</uri>
    </include>

    <physics type="ode">
      <max_step_size>0.001</max_step_size>
      <real_time_factor>1</real_time_factor>
      <real_time_update_rate>250</real_time_update_rate>
      <gravity>0 0 -9.8 </gravity>
    </physics>

    <model name="heightmap">
      <static>true</static>
      <link name="link">
        <collision name="collision">
          <geometry>
            <heightmap>
              <uri>file://media/dem/part_8.tif</uri>
              <pos>0 0 0</pos>
            </heightmap>
          </geometry>
        </collision>

        <visual name="visual_abcedf">
          <geometry>
            <heightmap>
              <texture>
                <diffuse>file://media/materials/textures/128.png</diffuse>
                <normal>file://media/materials/textures/128_normal.png</normal>
                <size>1</size>
              </texture>
              <uri>file://media/dem/part_8.tif</uri>
              <pos>0 0 0</pos>
            </heightmap>
          </geometry>
        </visual>

      </link>
    </model>

  </world>
</sdf>
```

What am I doing wrong?

Platform: Fedora 22 (gazebo 4)

content.raw:
Off the top of my head it's difficult to say why the textures aren't loading.

Here's a link to the directory structure that I finally got working:
https://bitbucket.org/complacs/crates/src/98ac1b5d757b/src/sim/?at=stable

Relevant terrain is located at ```models/hawkshead```
Relevant world is located at ```resources/worlds/hawkshead.world```

I use ROS to launch Gazebo, so the environment variables are set from within a launch file:

```
 <!-- start gazebo server-->
  <node name="client" pkg="sim" type="client" respawn="false" output="screen">
    <env name="GEOGRAPHICLIB_DATA" value="$(find sim)/resources/gis"/>
    <env name="GAZEBO_MASTER_URI" value="http://localhost:11345"/>
    <env name="GAZEBO_MODEL_DATABASE_URI" value="http://gazebosim.org/models"/>
    <env name="GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH" value="$(find sim)/models"/>
    <env name="GAZEBO_RESOURCE_PATH" value="/usr/local/share/gazebo-3.0:$(find sim)/resources"/>
    <env name="OGRE_RESOURCE_PATH" value="/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/OGRE-1.8.0"/>
  </node>
```

Hopefully that will help :)
content.html:
Off the top of my head it's difficult to say why the textures aren't loading.

Here's a link to the directory structure that I finally got working: https://bitbucket.org/complacs/crates/src/98ac1b5d757b/src/sim/?at=stable

Relevant terrain is located at models/hawkshead Relevant world is located at resources/worlds/hawkshead.world

I use ROS to launch Gazebo, so the environment variables are set from within a launch file:

 <!-- start gazebo server-->
  <node name="client" pkg="sim" type="client" respawn="false" output="screen">
    <env name="GEOGRAPHICLIB_DATA" value="$(find sim)/resources/gis"/>
    <env name="GAZEBO_MASTER_URI" value="http://localhost:11345"/>
    <env name="GAZEBO_MODEL_DATABASE_URI" value="http://gazebosim.org/models"/>
    <env name="GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH" value="$(find sim)/models"/>
    <env name="GAZEBO_RESOURCE_PATH" value="/usr/local/share/gazebo-3.0:$(find sim)/resources"/>
    <env name="OGRE_RESOURCE_PATH" value="/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/OGRE-1.8.0"/>
  </node>

Hopefully that will help :)
